latest.title: Change of name and TIDM
latest.content:
Today 10:49
RNS Number : 5289O
Cykel AI PLC
12 January 2026
This announcement contains information which, prior to its disclosure, was inside information as stipulated under Regulation 11 of the Market Abuse (Amendment) (EU Exit) Regulations 2019/310 (as amended). Upon the publication of this announcement via a Regulatory Information Service, this inside information is now considered to be in the public domain.
12 January 2026
DeFi Development Corporation UK PLC (formerly Cykel AI PLC)
(the "
Company
")
Change of name and TIDM
DeFi Development Corporation UK PLC (LSE: DFDV), a Main Market listed company which offers an AI agent platform that enables businesses to automate tasks through the use of specialised digital workers for
sales, recruitment and research and has adopted
a Solana focused digital asset treasury strategy,
is pleased to announce that the Company has changed its name and will trade under its new name DeFi Development Corporation UK PLC with effect from 12 January 2026.
In addition, with effect from 13 January 2026, the Company's TIDM will be amended from "CYK" to "DFDV" on the Main Market of the London Stock Exchange.
The decision to change name to
DeFi Development Corporation UK PLC
reflects the Company's continued development of its Solana focused digital asset treasury strategy as previously announced on 28 August 2025. The "Cykel" trading name will continue to be used for the Company's AI agent activities.
In addition, the Company's website address will also change to www.defidevcorp.co.uk.
Shareholders should note that their shareholdings will be unaffected by the change of name. Existing share certificates should be retained as they will remain valid for all purposes and no new share certificates will be issued.
The Company's ISIN and SEDOL will remain unchanged. The Company's Legal Entity Identifier remains 213800QEO6L6JAS62H02.
The Directors of the Company accept responsibility for this announcement.
*ENDS*
For further information:
Company
Michael Chan
Director
investors@defidevcorp.co.uk
First Sentinel (Corporate Adviser)
Brian Stockbridge
brian@first-sentinel.com
+44 (0) 7858 888 007

latest.title: Further re warrants
latest.content:
4 Dec 2025 07:00
RNS Number : 1455K
Cykel AI PLC
04 December 2025
This announcement contains information which, prior to its disclosure, was inside information as stipulated under Regulation 11 of the Market Abuse (Amendment) (EU Exit) Regulations 2019/310 (as amended). Upon the publication of this announcement via a Regulatory Information Service, this inside information is now considered to be in the public domain.
4 December 2025
Cykel AI PLC
("
Cykel AI
" or the "
Company
")
Further re Warrants
Cykel AI PLC (LSE:CYK) announces the following with respect to the warrants, full details of which are set out in the Company's announcement of 28 August 2025.
Warrants cancellation
The Company announces that it has agreed to the cancellation of 5,000,000 Pre-Paid and Investor Warrants (together, the "Warrants"). This will result in the repayment of the deposit already paid for the Pre-Paid Warrants (less a contribution to transaction costs) to the cancelling holders in accordance with the terms of the Warrants. Following this cancellation, the Company has 41,666,667 Warrants outstanding.
Warrants extension details
Under the existing terms, Warrants are not capable of being exercised until certain conditions which are detailed in the 28 August 2025 announcement have been satisfied and would have expired if such conditions were not satisfied by 30 November 2025. The Company and the remaining warrant holders, including DeFi Development Corp, have agreed to extend the period within which these conditions may be satisfied to 1 June 2026. Accordingly, the Warrants will only become exercisable once the relevant conditions have been fulfilled on or before 1 June 2026.
If the conditions have not been satisfied by 1 June 2026, the Warrants will expire and be cancelled and the deposit for the Pre-Paid Warrants will be repaid to the relevant investors (less pre
‑
agreed contributions to transaction costs).
All other terms of the Warrants remain unchanged.
Pre-Paid Warrants and Investor Warrants have the meanings given to them in the announcement published on 28 August 2025.
For further information:
Cykel AI plc
Michael Chan
CEO
investors@cykel.ai
First Sentinel (Financial Adviser)
Brian Stockbridge
brian@first-sentinel.com
+44 (0) 7858 888 007

Guy Wheatley

latest.title: Changes in Board Composition
latest.content:
3 Nov 2025 07:00
RNS Number : 7828F
Cykel AI PLC
03 November 2025
This announcement contains information which, prior to its disclosure, was inside information as stipulated under Regulation 11 of the Market Abuse (Amendment) (EU Exit) Regulations 2019/310 (as amended). Upon the publication of this announcement via a Regulatory Information Service, this inside information is now considered to be in the public domain.
3 November 2025
Cykel AI PLC
("Cykel AI" or the "Company")
Changes in Board Composition
Cykel AI PLC (LSE:CYK) announces that Nicholas Lyth has resigned as Interim Chairman of the Company, with immediate effect.
The Board would like to take this opportunity to thank Mr. Lyth for his contributions to the Company and wish him well for the future.
Michael Chan will assume the role of Chairman on an interim basis pending the appointment of a Non-executive Chairman in due course.
For further information:
Cykel AI plc
Michael Chan
CEO
investors@cykel.ai
First Sentinel (Financial Adviser)
Brian Stockbridge
brian@first-sentinel.com
+44 (0) 7858 888 007

+44 (0) 7493 989014

company_30s.what_they_do: Cykel AI builds and sells AI‑driven sales agents for small businesses.
company_30s.why_they_matter: If the tech scales, it could tap a £30bn UK sales‑automation market and offer a cheaper alternative to legacy CRMs.
company_30s.current_state: Struggling, pre‑revenue, trying to raise capital and prove early‑stage traction.

rns_narrative: Listing events: name change, TIDM filing and AGM updates over the last six months.
Fundraise: a £2.8m placement at 10p, a £750k secondary placing, and a capital‑raise announcement in June.
Product launches: GTM AI and Eve sales agent unveiled in August and June respectively, with a 68% MoM growth claim in June.
Strategic moves: Bitcoin treasury reserve strategy, commercial agreement with Transpharmation, and a block‑listing return report.
Governance: Board composition changes, director‑selling disclosures, and a change of name notice.

crowd_tape.dominant_theme: The community is largely silent; the few voices are split between hope for the new AI tools and worry about dilution and lack of revenue.
crowd_tape.bull_narrative: Bulls point to the AI launches and the 68% growth claim as evidence that the product is gaining traction and could break out once the placement is closed.
crowd_tape.bear_narrative: Bears argue the price is zero, there’s no real revenue, and the company is still raising money at steep discounts—an unsustainable path.
crowd_tape.sentiment_shift: Initially, the brief buzz around the name change sparked a brief spike, but sentiment has since flatlined as no earnings or concrete sales data were released.

whats_happening_now.attention_check: Google Trends shows zero interest; social media volume is nil. The story has lost oxygen—no new searches, no chatter, no trending hashtags.

near_term_catalysts: Q3 results (Sep): First revenue print or a clear cash‑flow forecast—essential for validating the AI product claims.
AGM (Sep): Potential vote on new share placement or dilution measures that could either dilute the price further or provide fresh capital.
Placement closing (Oct): If the £2.8m placement finalises, the price may react to the influx of capital.
expect_next.watch_for: Director selling (PDMR filings), any sign of a second placement, and the actual revenue figures from the June growth claim. The lack of any tangible sales or partnership announcements is a red flag.
expect_next.timing_regime: Late – the APEX score of 10/21 and a 96% drop from the peak suggest the price is stuck; any move will likely be driven by a catalyst rather than organic momentum.

buy_vs_sell.bull_case: If the company can close the placement, deliver real revenue, and show that the AI agents are converting leads, the price could rally from the current 0p base. A successful Q3 report would validate the 68% growth claim and attract speculative buying.
buy_vs_sell.bear_case: The zero price and lack of earnings mean the company is still in a pre‑revenue phase. Without a clear revenue stream, the placement may be a dilution event, and the price could remain at or near zero. The Bitcoin treasury strategy adds no tangible value to the business model.
buy_vs_sell.risk_reward: High risk, low reward – the upside is limited to a modest bounce if the placement closes; the downside is essentially a total loss of the invested capital.

playbook.if_bullish: Do not enter now; wait for a clear revenue announcement or a successful placement. If you do, start with a very small position (≤1% of the desk) and set a stop at 2p to protect against a flat or negative move.
playbook.if_watching: Hold off until the Q3 results are out. If the company shows tangible revenue or a positive cash‑flow forecast, consider a small entry on a dip, but keep the stop tight.
playbook.if_passing: The story is too early and the price is zero. No clear catalyst, no revenue, and no buzz. Pass for now and look for a more liquid, higher‑quality micro‑cap with a defined growth narrative.

ai_insights.bottom_line: Bearish – the company is still pre‑revenue, the price is zero, and there is no active market interest. Wait for a clear revenue or placement result before considering a speculative tiny position; otherwise, stay out.

commentary.executive_summary: Note: this report used historical signals only — live triangulation (RNS, social, Trends) was not available. Current setup looks like CROWDED with an APEX score of 43/100. Historically there have been 1 rallies (avg. 331%); the position is now +330.5%. Practical take: this is interesting but unconfirmed — wait for an AI snapshot or clear confirmation before committing size.
bull_case: No obvious upside without a catalyst
bear_case: No immediate red flags, but keep stops tight
commentary.timing_translation: Late-stage rally — trim into strength and tighten risk.
